alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 7:31AM PST until January 10 at 1:51PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shaver Lake, Mountain Rest, Shaver Lake 3ne, Trimmer Springs and Auberry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
